meanings.definition: A cut made in the skin or flesh.
meanings.sent1: The doctor made a small incision to remove the splinter.
meanings.sent2: The surgeon carefully stitched up the incision after the operation.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally made an incision in the wrapping paper while trying to open the gift.
meanings.sent4: Her words felt like a sharp incision into his heart.
meanings.sent5: The incision on the apple revealed its juicy interior.

meanings.definition: The act of cutting into something.
meanings.sent1: The incision into the cake revealed a surprise filling.
meanings.sent2: The incision of the knife through the fabric was precise.
meanings.sent3: The incision of the scissors through the paper sounded like music to her ears.
meanings.sent4: His incision into the conversation brought up a sensitive topic.
meanings.sent5: The incision of the chisel into the wood created a perfect groove.
